reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay 2 nights and went to a function at the nearby Golf club.
reviews.title: Nice Bedroom

reviews.text: The room was at the back of the pub and nice with plenty of room.
reviews.title: helpful...good service...basic but good if a little far from the city
Could not have asked for more!!!
reviews.text: Breakfast was good and excellent value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other meal was carvery bit plastcky as felt some of it had been out a while.
reviews.title: excellent value

reviews.text: Staff were super helpful. a basic, clean and quiet room with a continental brekky all for £40... ample parking but about 6 miles out from central brum... would use again. If you have to live like Alan Partridge for a few days this is good value and this particular branch has good staff!
reviews.title: Great value, efficient service

likes.disliked: — Bar shutting at 21.00 on New Years eve :(

reviews.text: Check in at bar (Not brilliant when busy) but friendly pleasant staff ensured we were in our clean room( with beds made inc sofa bed) in no time. No complaints whatsoever. Nice pub attached with top class array of beers and wines. Next morning very nice (free) continental breakfast.This was our first experience of innkeepers lodge, and we were suitably impressed. All for £29.95 per night for 2 adults 1 child with free breakfast on special pre pay rate.Great little place to stay.
reviews.title: Nice room.Friendly staff

reviews.text: We stayed at this Innkeeper's Lodge last Saturday night, since it was near to where we were attending a friend's birthday party. Perfect location for Four Oaks!
reviews.title: Great value, but check out the check-in!

likes.liked: — Location, safe parking, value and great breakfast.
likes.disliked: — The slowness of the Check-inn process. No lift in the main Lodge where we stayed.

reviews.text: The check-in process was the only problem and not really a good first impression of the 'human' side of the hotel/staff experience. We had to wait at the bar area, behind another group of guests who seemed to experience some problems, not least of which was that neither of the two rooms they had booked were ready to be occupied at 4pm. The result was that we we delayed in the check-in for our two rooms. We were repeatedly given apologies and after 15 minutes another member of staff came along and completed the check-in.
reviews.title: cheap weekend
Loved the Lodge
reviews.text: The two rooms we had were located in the Lodge facing the main bar/restaurant complex. The rooms were reasonably appointed and unlike the other low-cost 'Inns' and 'Lodges, a hairdryer was provided in each room. I regard this as a very basic 'non-luxury'. Parking was provided next to the Lodge.

reviews.title: Value for money
reviews.text: Good value for money – where could you get B & B for £30 per room per night (£15 per person) including morning paper and continental breakfast.
Room clean, hairdryer, decent shower and plenty of hot water, T.V with 7 channels incl. sport. Plenty of parking, some road noise but acceptable
reviews.title: very good especialy for the price

reviews.text: Pub/Carvery attached – good atmosphere, pleasant staff, good selection of drinks, food OK if you like carvery and definitely value for money.
reviews.title: Fantastic value - great staff

likes.liked: — Clean, well appointed room and toilet and shower

reviews.text: Good location for NEC (20 min. drive) and Birmingham (suggest you get train from Chester Road Station, 3 miles away), free parking, trains every 15min. and £2 return.
reviews.title: Fantastic for the price.

reviews.text: Plenty of restaurants and takeaways near bye, cinema (Empire) on the way to Sutton Coldfield and 24hr TESCO 1.5 miles away.
reviews.title: Reliably good service
